DGS&D, A Central Purchase Organization of Government of India which looks after for the items to be purchased by government departments on Rate Contract. Rate contract is a mutual agreement between suppliers and DGS&D to make item available on agreed rates as well as terms & condition for a specific period to the various departments of Government of India, State Government, and Public Undertakings etc called indentor’s to make readily available along with Technical Particulars of a specific item for specific RC period. There is online bidding process for availing E-tendering for required Tender Notices.

Jute e-Procurement System:
The Jute Corporation of India (JCI) is the nodal agency of the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India for procurement of raw jute through its 171 Departmental Purchase Centres (DPCs) and State Cooperative bodies in all major jute growing states at MSP declared by the Govt. of India. As per the mandate, the JCI procures the jute directly from the farmers who come to sell their raw jute at its DPCs and other Centres operated by State Cooperative Bodies. 

In the Jute e-Procurement system Indentors(FCI,Ministry of Textiles etc)places indents to DS&D. DS&D club the indents andprepare projection report through system and sends to Jute Commissioner office. Jute Commissioner distributes PCO(Projection Control Order) amongs indenting departments ,agencies. On the basis of PCO Requisition Order(RO) and Supply Order(SO) are generated by DS&D for Suppliers(Jute Mills). Jute mills produces the jute bags as per requisition order and place inspection calls to DQA Office for Inspection.Inspections process is carried out by Inspecting Officer and  inspection Quality Assurance Certificates(QAC), is issued for despatch.
